guide.introduction:
Paper birthday cards are boring...

So let's build an "Arduino LCD birthday card!"
guide.introduction_rendered:
Paper birthday cards are boring...

So let's build an "Arduino LCD birthday card!"

Relevant parts
  • Arduino
  • LCD-Display
  • 10K Potentiometer
  • Hook-up wire
  • Solderless breadboard

lines.text: Here are the materials you need:
lines.text_raw: Here are the materials you need:

lines.text: Arduino, LCD Display, 10K Potentiometer, USB cable, some hook-up wires and a solderless breadboard.
lines.text_raw: Arduino, LCD Display, 10K Potentiometer, USB cable, some hook-up wires and a solderless breadboard.

lines.text: First we connect the 5V and the Ground to the rails of the breadboard.
lines.text_raw: First we connect the 5V and the Ground to the rails of the breadboard.

lines.text: Then we add the potentiometer and connect it to 5V and Ground.
lines.text_raw: Then we add the potentiometer and connect it to 5V and Ground.

lines.text: Now we add the display and connect it to 5V (second pin) and Ground (first pin).
lines.text_raw: Now we add the display and connect it to 5V (second pin) and Ground (first pin).

lines.text: We connect the third pin of the LCD to the "wiper" (middle pin) of the potentiometer.
lines.text_raw: We connect the third pin of the LCD to the "wiper" (middle pin) of the potentiometer.

lines.text: Now turn the backlight on! Connect the sixteenth pin to Ground and the fifteenth pin to 5V.
lines.text_raw: Now turn the backlight on! Connect the sixteenth pin to Ground and the fifteenth pin to 5V.

lines.text: Plug in the USB cable and you should see the backlight light up!
lines.text_raw: Plug in the USB cable and you should see the backlight light up!

lines.text: Now it's time to connect the data pins! The list that follows is: Display Pin → Arduino Pin
lines.text_raw: Now it's time to connect the data pins! The list that follows is: Display Pin → Arduino Pin

lines.text: Now it's time to program the Arduino! Start with the code in the picture at left.
lines.text_raw: Now it's time to program the Arduino! Start with the code in the picture at left.

lines.text: Now it's finished! Print a sweet frame, cut it out and put it over the LCD.
lines.text_raw: Now it's finished! Print a sweet frame, cut it out and put it over the LCD.

guide.summary: Build a clever birthday card with an Arduino and an LCD.
